climbs.name: While I Still Got the Time

content.description: Just right of the corner is the black face with a roof at chest height.  Grab high crimps and burl your way up to the seam on high texture rock.  Climb on up to the anchor via technical and burly moves.  Good holds by and above anchor.
content.protection:
Stainless bolts to mussys 

  This route was bolted solely for the purpose of allowing for the first ascent, and the first ascent information is posted here solely to document the history of the first ascent. No person should read this posting with the assumption that this route or the fixed gear left behind is safe in any way or otherwise appropriate to allow for safe subsequent ascents. Climbing is dangerous and should only be done with the appropriate training and risk management practices that include providing for the climbers own safety. Attempting to climb this route as described above or by any other means or methods could result in injury or death.

content.description: Past a small bulge to easier terrain above.  Shares the bolts with "Unknown #3 (right variation)".
content.protection: 6 bolts to a pair of mussy hooks.

content.description: It sure looks harder than 5.9...but hidden holds make it so.  Fun slab climbing. Shares anchor with Exonerated.
content.protection:
Stainless bolts to shared mussy anchor

content.description: A nuance harder than "Unknown #1".  Shares the anchor with "Unknown #1".
content.protection: 3 bolts to a pair of chains

content.description: Shares the anchor with "Unknown #2".
content.protection: 4 bolts lead to a pair of chains.
content.location: Leftmost route on EnTRAPment Wall.  In front of a dead tree.  Red bolts.

climbs.name: Stuck in Uncle Pete's Cement Mixer
climbs.fa: Jon O'Brien, Mike Moore, Erik Reinhart

content.description: Starts on typical Sleepy Hollow rock and climbs up and left into some very unique rock that kind of looks like it has had cement poured down the wall.  Cool rock, technical movement, good climbing!
content.protection: Bolts to chain anchor

content.description: Fun climbing up great features the whole way.
content.protection:
Stainless bolts to mussys (I think this is the one where the anchors are kind of off right of the rest of the bolt line.)

climbs.name: Returning to the Scene of the Crime

content.description: Climb up and then right on OK rock to a couple of bolts of very fun and technical micro-stemming on great rock.  Super fun!

content.description: Follow puzzly pockets and pinches for 3-4 bolts. The climb eases up as it heads into a runnel leading to the same anchors as Capt'n Stab
content.protection: 6 bolts to chains
content.location: The higly pocketed bolted line just to the right of the obvious "Capt'n stab" dihedral climb

climbs.name: Once a Donut Eater...Always a Donut Eater  OK

content.description:
Climb the "waterfall" like dihedral using fun stemming to chains after a bit of face climbing.   

  GREAT!  By far the best route on this wall.

content.description: Just left of the huge corner. Climb 60 feet of continuously engaging and technical climbing to a ledge where there are mussys if you want to bail there (at 11A) or do a hard crimpy boulder problem on chert crimps to the second anchor at 80 feet.  Really fun if you like technical limestone routes.
content.protection:
Lots of (12?) stainless bolts to mussys.

content.description: This wall is on the upper cliff and on the far left.  This wall is loaded with fun moderates that climb really unique features.  The wall was burned many years ago (prior to the climbs/bolts) and that has had an effect on the rock quality.  With a little traffic, these routes will get better and better.  The features are awesome.
